Ilja Preuï¿½ wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
> wrote:
> 
>  > I don't know about jWebUnit out of the box, but there's no reason
> one
>  > couldn't use jWebUnit to test web page and web page templates in
>  > isolation from the rest of the system. I show the appropriate
> techniques
>  > in _JUnit Recipes_ using HtmlUnit, rather than jWebUnit. (The two
> tools
>  > are very similar.)
> 
> Ah, yes - but try testing a Servlet while stubbing/mocking the rest
> of the system. It can be done to some amount, but it's rather
> complicated and obviously not what jWebUnit or HttpUnit is designed
> for.

Naturally. HtmlUnit/jWebUnit/HttpUnit test /web pages/, and not servlets.

> How would you test that a servlet forwards to the correct JSP based
> on some entry in a database?

With ServletUnit. In fact, that might be in the book (chapter 12?), 
although ForwardingServlet doesn't check an entry in the database... it 
just uses a list in memory. Adding the database bit would be easy 
(chapter 10).
